item.title: Delhi Election Live Updates: Arvind Kejriwal launches campaign song for assembly polls - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Delhi Election Live Updates: Election Commission to announce Delhi polls schedule shortly

Publication Date: Recent updates from the Election Commission.

The Election Commission of India is set to announce the schedule for the General Election for the Legislative Assembly of Delhi. This announcement comes amidst a political row regarding the voter roll.

  • The Election Commission's press briefing is scheduled for 2:00 PM.
  • The term of the 70-member Assembly ends on February 23.
  • The final electoral roll shows over 1.55 crore registered voters in Delhi.
  • First-time voters aged 18-19 have increased by 52,554 since the last electoral roll.
  • AAP’s campaign song was released, highlighting achievements in governance.
  • Allegations of voter list manipulations raised by both AAP and BJP.
"We celebrate our elections like festivals, and people wait for our song; now it's out, and people can dance to it." - Arvind Kejriwal

The upcoming elections in Delhi are generating significant interest, with preparations underway from all political parties.

item.title: Rape Convict Asaram Bapu Gets Interim Bail, But Can't Meet His Followers - NDTV
item.description:
Asaram Granted Interim Bail by Supreme Court Despite Rape Convictions

Date: Recent news from Source: NDTV

A week after self-styled godman Asaram returned to jail from a previous parole, the Supreme Court has granted him interim bail on medical grounds in a 2013 rape case. However, he will remain incarcerated as he seeks bail in another case.

  • Asaram, 83, was convicted for raping a teenager in his Jodhpur ashram in 2013.
  • He has been sentenced to life imprisonment for the crime.
  • The court granted bail until March 31, with restrictions on meeting followers.
  • Police are instructed to escort him only for medical treatment.
  • Asaram's lawyers cited serious medical ailments in their request for bail.
Asaram is suffering from serious medical ailments.

The court's decision reflects ongoing legal proceedings amid his multiple convictions.

item.title: Madhya Pradesh: Doctor arrested for raping colleague inside abandoned govt medical college hostel - Hindustan Times
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: HMPV cases live: Centre, health experts appeal for calm after five test positive - Hindustan Times
item.description:
HMPV cases live: Odisha begins testing at several places following Centre advisory

Date: January 6, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The article discusses the initiation of testing for Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) in Odisha following guidance from the Centre after isolated cases were reported. It emphasizes the health measures being undertaken across various states.

  • Five cases of HMPV reported across India.
  • Odisha has started testing at several locations.
  • Symptoms include mild cold-like signs, with serious risks for young children and immunocompromised individuals.
  • No significant outbreak reported, and health officials urge calm.
“There is no need to panic,” said Gujarat Health Minister Rushikesh Patel.

In conclusion, while HMPV cases are being monitored, officials stress preparedness and public awareness over alarm.

item.title: Telangana High Court refuses to quash FIR against BRS MLA KT Rama Rao in Formula E Race case - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Telangana High Court Upholds FIR Against BRS MLA KT Rama Rao in Formula E Race Funding Case

Published on: 07 Jan 2025, 6:22 am

The Telangana High Court has refused to quash an FIR against BRS MLA K.T. Rama Rao related to allegations of corruption in the Formula E race funding case. The ruling comes amid claims of political vendetta and serious charges against Rao.

  • Justice K Lakshman dismissed the plea to quash the FIR.
  • The FIR involves charges of criminal breach of trust and violations of the Prevention of Corruption Act.
  • The allegations stem from irregularities in funding for the Formula E race, which was cancelled after the Congress took power.
  • Rao's counsel argued the case is politically motivated.
  • The State's Advocate General noted serious allegations against Rao, including alleged misappropriation of funds.
“Rao cannot be prosecuted simply on account of a policy decision taken in 2023.” - KTR's Senior Advocate C Aryama Sundaram

The court's decision reinforces serious scrutiny over the financial dealings associated with significant events in Telangana.

item.title: Assam mine: Three feared dead as India deploys divers, helicopters to rescue trapped miners - CNN
item.description:
Three Feared Dead as India Deploys Divers, Helicopters to Rescue Trapped Miners

Date: January 7, 2025 Source: CNN

Three miners are feared dead inside a flooded coal mine in Assam, India, as rescue teams work overnight to reach nine men trapped inside the mine.

  • Rescue teams reported spotting three bodies but have not yet recovered them.
  • The army has deployed divers, helicopters, and engineers for rescue operations.
  • The incident occurred due to flooding in the mine, likely caused by hitting a water channel.
  • Coal mining disasters are common in northeastern India, with past incidents resulting in significant casualties.
“The mine got flooded yesterday — the source was internal. They probably hit some water channel and water came out and flooded it,” Mayank Kumar, district police chief in Dima Hasao.

The rescue operation is ongoing, with efforts focused on reaching the nine trapped miners and recovering the bodies.

item.title: GATE 2025 Admit Card Released on gate2025.iitr.ac.in, Direct Link - Times Now
item.description:
GATE 2025 Admit Card Released on gate2025.iitr.ac.in, Direct Link

Publication Date: Today. Source: Times Now

The Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering (GATE) admit card has been released today, serving as a crucial document for candidates.

  • Essential for admission to postgraduate programs in IITs and IISc.
  • Must carry the admit card and a valid photo ID to the exam center.
  • GATE scores are also used by PSUs for recruitment.
  • Conducted jointly by IITs and IISc.

GATE 2025 Hall Ticket: Here's how to download admit card

  1. Visit the official website - gate2025.iitr.ac.in
  2. Access the GOAPS portal and log in.
  3. Enter enrollment ID and password.
  4. Download the admit card.

The GATE exam will occur on February 1, 2, 15, and 16, 2025.

item.title: HMPV cases live: Centre advises states to strengthen awareness measures - Hindustan Times
item.description:
HMPV cases live: Centre advises states to strengthen awareness measures

Publication Date: January 6, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Health authorities are advising states to increase public awareness and preparedness as five cases of Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) infections have been reported in India. The Centre emphasizes that these infections are manageable and not a cause for panic.

  • Five cases of HMPV reported in India, with no widespread outbreak.
  • Children under 3 and immunocompromised individuals advised to take precautions.
  • Health systems are being prepared to manage potential surges in cases.
  • Public health guidelines are being issued to strengthen awareness.
  • Health experts state that HMPV has been circulating globally since its identification in 2001.
“There is no need to panic. The government is ready for any situation.” - Uttar Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Brajesh Pathak

In conclusion, while cases of HMPV have been identified, health experts reassure the public that it is not a new virus, and normal precautions should suffice to prevent serious illness.

item.title: Three feared dead as India deploys divers, helicopters to rescue trapped miners - CNN
item.description:
Three feared dead as India deploys divers, helicopters to rescue trapped miners

Publication Date: Not specified   |   Source: CNN

Three miners are feared dead inside a flooded coal mine in Assam, India, while rescue teams are desperately trying to reach the trapped individuals.

  • Three bodies have been spotted but not yet recovered.
  • A total of nine men have been trapped since Monday in the mine.
  • Rescue operations involve army teams deploying divers and helicopters.
  • The mine flooded due to an internal water channel that was likely hit by the miners.
  • Previous coal mine disasters in northeastern India highlight ongoing safety concerns.
“The mine got flooded yesterday — the source was internal. They (the miners) probably hit some water channel and water came out and flooded it,” - Mayank Kumar, district police chief in Dima Hasao.

Efforts continue as local authorities and rescue teams strive to recover those trapped and prevent further loss of life.

item.title: Delhi Assembly poll schedule LIVE updates: Election Commission to announce dates at 2 p.m. - The Hindu
item.description:
Delhi Assembly poll schedule LIVE updates: Election Commission to announce dates at 2 p.m.

Date Published: January 07, 2025

Source: The Hindu

The Election Commission of India is set to announce the schedule for the Delhi Assembly elections today at 2 p.m. Follow live updates on developments.

  • The upcoming elections will have a three-cornered contest between BJP, Congress, and AAP.
  • AAP leader Arvind Kejriwal has announced ₹10 lakh insurance for auto drivers.
  • The turnout for new voter registrations is unprecedented, with an increase of over 1.67 lakh names on the electoral roll.
“I wrote to the Chief Election Commissioner, with all these details, on how the large scale voter scam is happening in the New Delhi Assembly constituency.” – Atishi, Delhi Chief Minister.

This election is crucial, as it will shape political dynamics in Delhi.

item.title: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar visits Konark Sun Temple in Odisha ahead of Pravasi Bharatiya Divas - OTV News
item.description:
S Jaishankar Visits Konark Sun Temple Ahead of Pravasi Bharatiya Divas

Publication Date: Recent

Source: OTV News

Ahead of the Pravasi Bharatiya Divas in Odisha, Indian External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar visited the Konark Sun Temple and Interpretation Centre.

  • Jaishankar commenced his visit at the Interpretation Centre, which showcases the cultural significance of Konark.
  • Non-Resident Indians (NRIs) gathered in Bhubaneswar for the Pravasi Bharatiya Divas celebrations.
  • Attendees visited the sacred Jagannath Temple in Puri, seeking blessings.
  • The event emphasizes the connection between India and its overseas citizens while showcasing Odisha’s cultural heritage.
Several visitors expressed their joy and appreciation for the spiritual experience at the Konark Sun Temple.

This visit fosters a deeper connection for NRIs with their heritage, enriching their cultural experience in Odisha.

item.title: Mumbai fraud: Investors gather outside Torres Jewellery office in Dadar over unpaid returns; company blames CEO | Today News - Mint
item.description:
Investors Protest at Torres Jewellery Over Unpaid Returns in Mumbai

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Lokmat Times

A large crowd of investors gathered outside the Torres Jewellery office in Dadar, demanding refunds for the promised returns from the company’s investment schemes.

  • Investors had invested significant amounts, expecting weekly returns of 10%.
  • The company failed to disburse instalments for the last two weeks.
  • Many investors stated, “We don't need interest, just the money back.”
  • The company's CEO, Tausif Reyaz, has been blamed for the fraudulent scheme.
  • Complaints have been registered against top executives for allegedly cheating investors.
“On investing ₹1 lakh in a scheme floated by the store, customers would get a discount of ₹10,000 on a pendant with a moissanite stone.”

The police have deployed security at the location as protests continue and the situation unfolds.

item.title: Delhi election: Poll official requests enhanced security, cites political pressure - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Delhi election: Poll official requests enhanced security, cites political pressure

Date: Jan 07, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The New Delhi district election officer (DEO) has requested enhanced security due to alleged political interference ahead of the Delhi assembly elections.

  • The DEO claims to have faced political pressure regarding the voter list and sought police security for the DEO's office.
  • Accusations between the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) and the BJP regarding electoral roll irregularities have escalated.
  • Additional officials have echoed similar concerns about potential disruptions during election preparations.
“There is a possibility of breach of peace and pressures being imposed on the office functionaries,” said Additional District Magistrate Nishant Bodh.

The situation highlights growing tensions as the election approaches, necessitating urgent attention to ensure a fair electoral process.

item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Air India flight makes emergency landing after engine shuts off midair - The Hindu
item.description:
Air India Flight 2820 Makes Emergency Landing Due to Engine Failure

Date: January 07, 2025 Source: The Hindu

A Delhi-bound Air India flight made an emergency landing after one of its engines shut off midair. The flight, that took off from Kempegowda International Airport in Bengaluru, returned safely with no incidents reported.

  • The incident occurred on January 5, 2024, shortly after takeoff.
  • Flight 2820 took off around 7 p.m. and circled Bengaluru before landing an hour later.
  • All passengers were reported safe with no injuries.
No untoward incident happened and all the passengers were safe.

This emergency landing highlights the importance of aircraft safety and protocol in the aviation industry.

item.title: Election Commission to announce Delhi Assembly poll schedule at 2 pm today - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Election Commission to Announce Delhi Assembly Poll Schedule Today at 2 PM

Date: January 7, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The Election Commission of India (ECI) is set to announce the schedule for the upcoming Assembly elections in Delhi, with a press conference scheduled for January 7 at 2 PM. The term of the current Assembly ends on February 23.

  • The ECI will reveal the election schedule at a press conference.
  • The last elections occurred on January 6, 2020, with polling on February 8.
  • The AAP is aiming for a third consecutive term, while the BJP seeks to gain control.
  • Congress is also preparing to challenge the AAP and BJP in the elections.
  • The AAP has released its candidate list for the elections, marking a proactive electoral strategy.
The AAP dominated the previous elections, winning 67 and 62 seats in 2015 and 2020 respectively.

The upcoming elections are critical for the political landscape in Delhi, especially after recent developments regarding political alliances and candidate selections.

item.title: Man moves Bombay High Court for termination of pregnancy of daughter with borderline intelligence - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Father Seeks Legal Termination of Pregnant Daughter's Pregnancy in Court

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Not specified

A 66-year-old father has approached the Bombay High Court seeking permission to terminate the pregnancy of his 27-year-old daughter, who has below-average intelligence and refuses to consent to the procedure.

  • The daughter is over 20 weeks pregnant and has not revealed the identity of the child's father.
  • The court criticized the father's parenting choices and referred the case to a medical board for evaluation.
  • The father claims financial constraints and old age are reasons for seeking termination, but the court rejected these claims.
  • The court emphasized parental responsibility and questioned the parent's actions regarding their daughter's wellbeing.
  • The case is set to be reviewed further after the medical board’s assessment.
“What kind of parenting is this?” - Bombay High Court

The court's decision will reflect on parental responsibilities and the implications of consent in sensitive matters like termination of pregnancy.

item.title: 2 Children Test Positive For HMPV In Maharashtra's Nagpur - News18
item.description:
Two Children Test Positive For HMPV In Maharashtra's Nagpur

Date: January 07, 2025 Source: News18

Two children have tested positive for the Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) in Maharashtra’s Nagpur. The children, aged 7 and 13 years, presented symptoms of cough and fever.

  • Positive cases add to previously reported infections in Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, and Gujarat.
  • Four other cases of HMPV infections were detected recently in Karnataka and Tamil Nadu.
  • Officials assure there is no cause for panic; the infections are from non-life-threatening strains.
  • Union Health Minister JP Nadda emphasizes preparedness and monitoring of the situation.
“The health systems and surveillance network of the country remain vigilant... There is no reason to worry, we are closely monitoring the situation.” - JP Nadda

This development underlines the importance of continuous surveillance for respiratory viruses, especially with the rise of respiratory illnesses linked to HMPV in other regions including China.

item.title: Transformer theft plunges UP village into darkness for weeks; police suspect ‘insider’ involvement: Report - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Transformer Theft Leaves UP Village Without Power for Weeks; Police Suspect Insider Involvement

Date: Jan 07, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The theft of a transformer in Soraha village, Uttar Pradesh, has left residents without electricity for weeks, disrupting studies for children preparing for upcoming state board exams.

  • The transformer was stolen on December 14, with all essential parts removed.
  • Villagers reported the missing transformer, which was later found dumped in a field.
  • Local authorities are investigating the theft; insider involvement is suspected.
  • Villagers are facing severe hardships due to power outages amid cold weather.
  • Police have registered an FIR and are investigating using mobile and CCTV evidence.
“Without power, inverters and mobile phones are useless, and submersible pumps are non-operational,” - Satpal Singh, village head.

The persistent power outage has prompted residents to demand better action from local officials and heightened security measures.

item.title: Oyo launches new check-in policy starting January 2025: Unmarried couples will no longer be ... - The Times of India
item.description:
Oyo launches new check-in policy starting January 2025: Unmarried couples will no longer be accepted

Date: October 2023 Source: Oyo News

Oyo has announced a new policy set to take effect in January 2025, which will prevent unmarried couples from checking into their hotels. This move has raised significant discussion regarding its implications for travel and accommodation services.

  • The new policy will only allow check-ins for couples who can prove they are married.
  • This decision aims to align with cultural values in certain regions.
  • Oyo states that this change is necessary to ensure safety and comfort for all guests.
  • Reaction from the public is mixed, with many expressing concerns over discrimination.
"We believe this policy will enhance the experience for our clientele," said a spokesperson for Oyo.

The new policy reflects a growing trend among hospitality chains to impose strict guidelines on check-in requirements. As society continues to evolve, the conversation around such policies will likely intensify.

item.title: Delhi-NCR Earthquake: Tremors felt in Delhi, Noida, Greater Noida after earthquake in Nepal - India.com
item.description:
Delhi-NCR Earthquake: Tremors felt in Delhi, Noida, Greater Noida after earthquakes in Bihar and Nepal

Published: January 7, 2025 7:09 AM IST | Source: India.com

Tremors were felt in Delhi, Noida, Greater Noida on Tuesday following a Nepal earthquake near Gokarneshwar, with a likely magnitude of 6-7.

  • Tremors were reported in Delhi, Noida, and Greater Noida.
  • The earthquake in Nepal had an estimated magnitude of 6-7.
  • Residents felt the tremors early in the morning.
"Tremors were felt in Delhi, Noida, Greater Noida on Tuesday following a Nepal earthquake..."

This earthquake serves as a reminder of the seismic activity in the region, raising concerns about preparedness and response strategies for future incidents.

item.title: Nepal Earthquake: Massive 7.1 Magnitude Quake Strikes Lobuche, Tremors In Kathmandu - Times Now
item.description:
Nepal Earthquake: Massive 7.1 Magnitude Quake Strikes Lobuche, Tremors In Kathmandu

Publication Date: Early on Tuesday

Source: Times Now

A massive 7.1 magnitude earthquake struck near the Nepal-Tibet border, causing tremors across Kathmandu and neighboring Indian cities. No reports of damage have emerged so far.

  • The quake's epicenter was located approximately 91 km from Lobuche, Nepal.
  • Tremors were felt in New Delhi, Siliguri, Patna, Bangladesh, Bhutan, and China.
  • Previous earthquakes in the region include a recent 4.8 magnitude quake in Nepal.
  • Nepal is prone to earthquakes due to the collision of Indian and Eurasian tectonic plates.
“An #Earthquake with the magnitude of 6.4 has hit #Nepal earlier today morning. People came out of their homes.”

The earthquake serves as a reminder of the seismic risks in the region, highlighting the need for continued preparedness and monitoring.
